pr_title: Add operations to create and delete SAML provider configs.

timeline.message: Add create and delete operations for SAML provider configs.
Add create and delete operations for SAML provider configs.
Add create and delete operations for SAML provider configs.

timeline.author: hiranya911

timeline.bodyText: Also check for prefix and throw?
timeline.author: hiranya911

replies.bodyText:
Sure! I've decided to add a static SamlProviderConfig.checkSamlProviderId method so that we don't duplicate the logic in too many places.
Also made the relevant changes for OIDC provider config checks too.
replies.author: micahstairs

timeline.bodyText: Ideally all argument validation should happen outside the CallableOperation. This looks like it would validate the request parameters within the CallableOperation.
timeline.author: hiranya911

replies.bodyText: Okay, I've moved it for both createSamlProviderConfigOp and createOidcProviderConfigOp. I've added TODOs for a couple other operations that were starting to get out of scope for this PR.
replies.author: micahstairs

timeline.bodyText: Just a hunch. See if you can use GenericJson in place of Map<String, Object>. If it works, it would clean things up a bit.
timeline.author: hiranya911

replies.bodyText:
If I try to cast it to GenericJson I get the following error:
java.lang.ClassCastException: com.google.api.client.util.ArrayMap cannot be cast to com.google.api.client.json.GenericJson
replies.author: micahstairs

timeline.message: Clean up provider config ID prefix assertions.
Move argument validation of create provider config methods outside CallableOperation.

timeline.bodyText: This still reads a bit weird. Shouldn't it be a new OIDC auth provider config...?
timeline.author: hiranya911

replies.bodyText: Sorry, thanks for catching that typo.
replies.author: micahstairs

timeline.bodyText: Seems we can remove this helper method now and just call checkOidcProviderId() in its place.
timeline.author: hiranya911
hiranya911

timeline.bodyText: Is there a better way capture these tests without directly testing on internal methods? May be run tests on public methods getProviderConfig() and deleteProviderConfig() with invalid arguments to verify this behavior.
timeline.author: hiranya911

replies.bodyText: I've moved the testing to the API level!
replies.author: micahstairs

timeline.author: hiranya911

timeline.message: Clean up prefix checks and move testing to API level.

timeline.bodyText: Nit: You can also pass a value like saml.InvallidProviderId here so the invalid prefix will get tested more explicitly.
timeline.author: hiranya911

timeline.message: Rename invalid provider config IDs used in unit tests.
